meanings.definition: To establish territorial boundaries or claims.
meanings.sent1: The animals territorialize their living spaces by marking them with scent.
meanings.sent2: The country decided to territorialize its borders to prevent any disputes.
meanings.sent3: The neighbors jokingly territorialize the shared driveway with colorful flags.
meanings.sent4: The ancient tribes would territorialize their hunting grounds with mystical symbols.
meanings.sent5: The concept of territorializing land dates back to ancient civilizations.

meanings.definition: To make something territorial in nature.
meanings.sent1: The new law will territorialize the previously unclaimed land.
meanings.sent2: The artist's paintings territorialize the emotions of the characters.
meanings.sent3: The children's game territorializes the play area with imaginary boundaries.
meanings.sent4: The music festival will territorialize the park with different stages.
meanings.sent5: The company's branding efforts aim to territorialize the market with their logo.

meanings.definition: To assert ownership or control over a specific area.
meanings.sent1: The company territorializes the market by offering unique products.
meanings.sent2: The king territorialized the kingdom by building strong fortresses.
meanings.sent3: The chef territorializes the kitchen, ensuring no one touches his knives.
meanings.sent4: The politician territorializes his constituency by attending every event.
meanings.sent5: The explorer territorializes the uncharted lands by planting flags.
